channel.title: Help with science
channel.description:
Can someone help me with something called acid rain. Can you also post related facts?
Thanks[br][size=1]Posted at: December 10, 2006, 06:32:44 PM[/size][hr]So does anyone know anything??

item.title: Help with science
item.dc:creator: @BobDole81 BobDole81
item.description:
@BobDole81 wrote:

13om13e12:

also if you dont know what Ph is its the acidic lvls from lvl 1 - 13 where 13 is the oposite of acidic and 1 is the highest lvl of acidic. and 7 is water.

Technically, the pH range is actually between 0-14, as a given solution may have between 10[sup]0[/sup] to 10[sup]-14[/sup] H+ atoms per mole.

Read full topic

item.title: Help with science
item.dc:creator: @BobDole81 BobDole81
item.description:
@BobDole81 wrote:

Acid rain is a result of carbon/sulfur dioxide/monoxide and other nitrogen-based emissions. These chemicals react with each other as well as with the water vapor in the upper atmosphere and are returned to Earth as rain with a sometimes dangerously low pH.

http://pubs.usgs.gov/gip/acidrain/2.html
http://www.geography-site.co.uk/pages/environ/acid.html
http://www.enviroliteracy.org/article.php/2.html

Read full topic
